par.text: Molybdenum is a silvery-white, hard and brittle metal, a good conductor of heat and electricity.
It is rather non-reactive at room temperature, but when heated, it reacts with oxygen to produce molybdenum(VI) oxide
. Molybdenum reacts with concentrated sulphuric(VI) acid, concentrated nitric(V) acid and with

(a mixture of 3 parts of concentrated hydrochloric acid and 1 part of concentrated nitric(V) acid by volume). Molybdenum was discovered in 1778 by the Swedish chemist Karl Wilhelm Scheele. Its name is derived from the Greek word
